title: Banned... thoughts?
body:

replies.body:
There was really no reason to flame from the start of the game. I get that you played with him prior to this game but why spread the negativity? If you have bad feelings about the person, you should just keep it to yourself because all you're going to do is make other people give up faster. Not only have your teammates just been told you are tilted already, but you're also giving up already. So then your teammates are less likely to play as hard because they know they're already down to a 4v5 because you've given up.

You need to learn to handle difficult situations better. Sure it sucks to be in a game with someone who you had a bad experience with previously, but you have to just learn to let it go. They may have had a bad game in your past experience. This game could have been different but you didn't give the player the chance and you told your teammates you were giving up already. 

You're on thin ice right now because after a 14 day ban, your next punishment is a permaban. 

You flame once,  you argue once, you harass once... anything bad once... you're going to get a permaban. 

Read your pop up notice and take it seriously. Don't lose your champs. Don't lose your skins. 

If you feel the urge to type, if it's because of any negative emotion, anger, frustration, hate, etc... don't type it. No sarcasm, no passive aggressiveness, no nothing. The IFS can pick up on sarcasm and so can player behavior specialists. Don't try to sneak some bad comments in there because you think you will get away with it.

I'm slightly curious - were you on chat restriction during this game? The length of message and low number makes me suspect you may have been.

If you were, know that while restricted your behavior will be examined more closely than a clean account. The idea being that you are serving a punishment for negativity already - and if you show that you're going to continue to be negative, even in only one game, while on punishment, it's obviously not working.

Please keep in mind as someone else said that after the 14 day ban, even "light" negativity in as little as one game can get your account permanently banned. I strongly recommend taking a step back and finding the fun again - because if you're not having fun and enjoying yourself now, you'll be having even less fun when permanently banned.

And that seems to be the root of the problem - your fun was negatively impacted by others, thus you flame them for it. You can't control others, as much as we would like to. All you can control is yourself - so make yourself have fun even if you're losing. It takes effort. But it is possible.

You started off by flaming him and continued to do so. And going by the previous game, you also threw it, likely flaming him.

His past games show he is not a troll at all, just likely not capable of carrying your dead weight. Your past games, on the other hand.. While not trolling, it does not look like you have a right to call anyone else out for playing badly.

Next time is permban. Take a step back and think about things a little more objectively.
